intro: Wittmackia abbreviata, commonly known as the dwarf poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive cyathia, or cup-like flower clusters. The plant features showy, bright red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous flowers, giving it a striking appearance. It is a compact shrub, typically growing to a height of about 30 centimeters. Wittmackia abbreviata thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
